intro: Monoteles, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Monoteles is an annual herb that thrives in well-drained environments. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been historically used for textile production, similar to other members of its family.
